page.title: 16FARMING AROUND SLEAFORD
page.content: THERE ARE 5 FARMS IN THE AREA,GROWING MAINLY WHEAT,BARLEY,SUGAR BEET AND POTATOES. THE AVERAGE NUMBER OF MEN PER FARM IS 1.4 AND THE AVERAGE NUMBER OF TRACTORS PER acre IS 1.6 TWO OF THE FARMS ARE OWNED BY THE FARMER THE OTHERS BEING TENANT FARMERS.TWO OF THE FARMS ARE MIXED THE LARGEST HAVING 120 BEEF CATTLE AND THE OTHER HAVING 60 AND AROUND 60 LAMBS IN THE SPRING. MOST OF THE AREA IS DRAINED BY FIELD BECK AND THE RIVER SLEA AND THE MAJORITY OF THE FARMLAND IS IN THE PARISH OF HOLDINGHAM. THE SOIL RANGES FROM LIMESTONE HEATH ,TO HEAVY CLAY AND RIVERSIDE SANDY PEAT {BY JOANNA HOBSON AGE (18)}
